name: Silicon Effects on Wheat Yield and Quality
description: This meta-analysis examines how silicon (Si) application affects wheat grain yield, biomass, and mineral composition. Silicon is a beneficial element that improves stress tolerance. Based on Li et al. 2022 dataset.
intervention: Silicon fertilization (various forms: sodium silicate, potassium silicate, calcium silicate, diatomaceous earth)
control: No silicon application or zero Si treatment
primary_outcomes: Mineral concentrations (Si, N, P, K, Ca, Mg, Fe, Zn, Mn)
typical_effect_size: +5% to +25% for grain yield; variable for minerals
important_moderators: Silicon source (sodium silicate, potassium silicate, etc.)
Stress conditions (drought, salinity, heavy metal, none)
extraction_priorities: 1. CRITICAL: Extract EVERY ROW from tables - NO POOLING across cultivars, rates, or stress levels
2. If table has Si rate x stress level = 8 rows, extract all 8
3. Control = zero Si or no Si treatment
5. Record the Si rate/dose for each treatment
6. Note stress conditions (drought, salinity, Cd, Cr) as moderators
tc_confusion_warnings: Control is the zero-Si treatment, NOT untreated plants
Some papers use multiple Si rates - extract EACH rate vs control separately
Factorial designs with Si x stress: extract each combination as separate observation
LSD is common in agronomy papers - extract it as a variance measure
If effect is strongly negative (-50%), verify the correct control group
